meanings.definition: Inclined to nibble or snack frequently.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit was nibbly, always munching on carrots.
meanings.sent2: The crackers were nibbly, perfect for a quick snack.
meanings.sent3: The nibbly squirrel kept stealing nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her nibbly nature made her the go-to person for tasting new desserts.
meanings.sent5: The nibbly hamster's cheeks were always full of food.

meanings.sent1: The nibbly grapes were a hit at the party.
meanings.sent2: The cookies were nibbly, ideal for sharing with friends.
meanings.sent3: The nibbly popcorn disappeared quickly during the movie.
meanings.sent4: The nibbly sushi was gone in seconds at the buffet.
meanings.sent5: The nibbly appetizers were a delight at the event.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency to nibble or eat small amounts.
meanings.sent1: The nibbly toddler always wanted a taste of everything.
meanings.sent2: The nibbly cat enjoyed small portions of fish throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The nibbly goat kept trying to nibble on people's clothing.
meanings.sent4: Her nibbly dog would sneakily grab treats from the counter.
meanings.sent5: The nibbly bird pecked at the seeds in the feeder.
